STAT 200.name: STAT 200
STAT 200.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
STAT 200.title: Elementary Statistics for Applications

STAT 241.name: STAT 241
STAT 241.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
STAT 241.title: Introductory Probability and Statistics

STAT 251.name: STAT 251
STAT 251.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
STAT 251.title: Elementary Statistics

STAT 300.name: STAT 300
STAT 300.prereqText: One of STAT 200, STAT 203, STAT 241, STAT 251, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, POLI 380, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366.
STAT 300.title: Intermediate Statistics for Applications

STAT 302.name: STAT 302
STAT 302.prereqText: One of MATH 200, MATH 226, MATH 217, MATH 253, MATH 254.
STAT 302.title: Introduction to Probability

STAT 305.name: STAT 305
STAT 305.prereqText: Either (a) one of STAT 200, STAT 203, BIOL 300, STAT 241, STAT 251, COMM 291, ECON 325, FRST 231, PSYC 218, PSYC 366 and one of MATH 302, STAT 302;  or (b) a score of 65% or higher in one of MATH 302, STAT 302. The Department recommends that students meet the prerequisite through option (a).
STAT 305.title: Introduction to Statistical Inference

STAT 306.name: STAT 306
STAT 306.prereqText: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of STAT 200, STAT 241, STAT 251, STAT 300, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366 and one of MATH 302, STAT 302.
STAT 306.title: Finding Relationships in Data

STAT 321.name: STAT 321
STAT 321.prereqText: One of EECE 269, ELEC 221, STAT 305. STAT 305 may be taken concurrently, with registration assistance from Statistics Student Services.
STAT 321.title: Stochastic Signals and Systems

STAT 344.name: STAT 344
STAT 344.prereqText: One of STAT 200, STAT 241, STAT 251, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366.
STAT 344.title: Sample Surveys

STAT 443.name: STAT 443
STAT 443.prereqText: One of MATH 302, MATH 318, STAT 302 and one of STAT 200, STAT 241, STAT 251, STAT 300, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, POLI 380, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366.
STAT 443.title: Time Series and Forecasting

STAT 460.name: STAT 460
STAT 460.prereqText: All of MATH 320, STAT 305 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
STAT 460.title: Statistical Inference I
